sn48.46:4.2: “Mendicants, how many faculties must a mendicant develop and cultivate so that they can declare enlightenment:
sn48.46:4.3: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence”’?”
sn48.46:5.1: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”
sn48.46:5.2: “A mendicant must develop and cultivate two faculties so that they can declare enlightenment.
sn48.46:5.6: For their noble wisdom is the faculty of wisdom.
sn48.46:5.7: And their noble freedom is the faculty of samādhi.
sn48.46:5.8: These are the two faculties that a mendicant must develop and cultivate so that they can declare enlightenment:
sn48.46:5.9: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’”
